intro: Cicer kermanense, commonly known as Kerman vetch, is a leguminous plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, lens-shaped pods containing one or two seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species adapted to dry conditions. Cicer kermanense is often used as a forage crop and has potential agricultural and ecological significance.
